abstracts.cdata!:
This project paper is for an additional
            loan for the Credit Sector Strengthening and Rural
            Microfinance Capacity Building Project in Mexico The
            additional loan would help finance scaling-up of project
            activities relating to the following component: Expanding
            Financial Services in Rural Marginal Areas. It relates to
            the first stage additional financing project. The project
            development objective and design of the Secretaria de
            Agricultura, Ganaderia, Desarrollo Rural, Pesca y
            Alimentacion (SAGARPA) component continue to be relevant,
            and remain fundamentally unaltered for the purposes of the
            additional financing loan. The scale and geographic scope of
            the SAGARPA component, however, are expanded for the
            additional financing loan. The SAGARPA component of the
            Phase I project aims at promoting secure and sustainable
            financial services in rural marginal areas, through
            specialized technical assistance and training. There are
            four main reasons for scaling up this component: (a)
            uniqueness of the component and the approach to its
            implementation; (b) highly successful implementation
            performance and satisfactory development outcome; (c) need
            to expand the limited initial geographical coverage; and (d)
            strong government commitment to the scale-up of this component.
